storyContent.tagHTML: A Bond of Friendship and a Secret Vow

In a past life, King Mahäbal and his six childhood friends were inseparable. Inspired by a sermon, all seven renounced their worldly lives to become monks together. However, Mahäbal secretly held a deeper aspiration: to guide all living beings to liberation. He observed longer, secret austerities, an act which earned him Tirthankar-Näm-Karma. But because of the secrecy from his friends, he also acquired karma to be born as a female.
A Princess, a Portrait, and a Proposal

The soul of Mahäbal was reborn as Princess Malli to King Kumbha and Queen Prabhävati of Mithilä. His six friends were reborn as powerful kings in neighboring kingdoms. An artist, after seeing only Princess Malli's toe, drew a perfect, lifelike portrait of her. The artist, after a dispute, showed this captivating portrait to the six kings. Each king, enchanted by her beauty, sent a marriage proposal to her father.
King Kumbha rejected all six proposals. In response, the angered kings united their armies and laid siege to the city of Mithilä.

Seeing the crisis, Princess Malli devised a plan. She commissioned a hollow, life-like statue of herself. For days, she had a morsel of food placed inside the statue, which was then sealed. She invited the six kings to the palace, placing each in a separate room where they could see the beautiful statue but not each other. As they waited, infatuated, Malli unsealed the statue.

A foul odor from the rotting food inside filled the air, repulsing the kings. The real Malli then appeared and explained: “This is the smell of the same food I eat. What is the purpose of being attached to a body when it is destined to decay?” She then revealed their connection from their past life as friends, causing them all to remember their spiritual vows.

The lesson learned, the six kings and Princess Malli all decided to renounce the world. On the very day she became a nun, Malli destroyed her obscuring karmas and attained Keval-jnän (omniscience), becoming the 19th Tirthankar. As Bhagawän Mallinäth, she preached the path to liberation before ultimately attaining Nirväna on Mount Sametshikhar.

events.title: A Pact of Friendship
events.description: King Mahäbal and his six close friends renounce their worldly lives together to become monks.

events.title: Secret Austerities
events.description: Mahäbal secretly performs extra penance to gain the ability to liberate all beings, acquiring both Tirthankar-Näm-Karma and karma to be born female.

events.title: A Princess is Born
events.description: Mahäbal's soul is reborn as Princess Malli. His six friends are reborn as six powerful kings.

events.title: The Portrait and the Proposals
events.description: A perfect portrait of Malli inflames the desire of the six kings, who all propose marriage.

events.title: The Siege of Mithilä
events.description: After their proposals are rejected, the six kings unite their forces and lay siege to Malli's city.

events.title: The Statue's Lesson
events.description: Malli uses a life-like statue filled with rotting food to teach the kings about the impermanence and impurity of the physical body.

events.title: Mass Renunciation
events.description: Remembering their past lives and understanding the lesson, Malli and all six kings renounce the world.

events.title: Omniscience and Nirväna
events.description: Malli attains Keval-jnän on the day of her initiation, becoming the 19th Tirthankar. She preaches and ultimately attains liberation at Sametshikhar.

charactersData.name: Bhagawän Mallinäth
charactersData.description: The 19th Tirthankar, who was born as a female (Princess Malli) according to Shvetämbar tradition. In a past life as King Mahäbal, her secret desire to save all beings led to this destiny. She is known for her wisdom in teaching the impermanence of the body.

charactersData.name: The Six Kings
charactersData.description: The rebirth of Mallinäth's six close friends from her life as King Mahäbal. Their deep past-life affection manifested as a worldly desire to marry her, leading to conflict.

charactersData.name: King Kumbha & Queen Prabhävati
charactersData.description: The royal parents of Princess Malli and rulers of Mithilä.

charactersData.name: The Artist
charactersData.description: A talented portrait artist whose drawing of Princess Malli inadvertently sparked the conflict among the six kings.

quizData.question: In her past life, what was Bhagawän Mallinäth's name?
What two specific karmas did Mahäbal acquire due to his secret, intense penance?
quizData.answer: Tirthankar-Näm-Karma and the karma to be born as a female.

quizData.question: Who were the parents of Princess Malli?
How did the six kings learn of Princess Malli's exceptional beauty?
quizData.answer: An artist showed them a lifelike portrait he had drawn of her.

quizData.question: What did the six kings do when their marriage proposals were rejected?
quizData.answer: They united their armies and laid siege to her city, Mithilä.

quizData.question: What did Princess Malli use to teach the kings a lesson about physical attachment?
quizData.answer: A hollow, life-like statue of herself filled with rotting food.

quizData.question: What was the lesson of the rotting food inside the beautiful statue?
quizData.answer: That the physical body is impermanent and destined to decay, so attachment to it is pointless.

quizData.question: What did the kings and Malli do after she revealed their past-life connection?
quizData.answer: They all renounced the worldly life to pursue the spiritual path.

quizData.question: Mallinäth is which Tirthankar in the sequence of 24?
Where did Bhagawän Mallinäth attain final liberation (Nirväna)?

graphicsData.title: The Seven Friends
graphicsData.description: In a past life, King Mahäbal and his six friends are so inspired by a sermon that they decide to renounce their kingdoms and become monks together.
graphicsData.imageAlt: Seven royal figures giving up their crowns to become monks.

graphicsData.title: The Fateful Portrait
graphicsData.description: An artist, after being punished, takes revenge by showing a captivating portrait of Princess Malli to a neighboring king, igniting a passionate desire.
graphicsData.imageAlt: An artist presenting a beautiful portrait of a princess to an amazed king.

graphicsData.title: The Siege
graphicsData.description: After King Kumbha rejects all their marriage proposals, the six enchanted kings unite their armies and lay siege to the city of Mithilä.
graphicsData.imageAlt: Armies with flags of six different kingdoms surrounding a fortified city.

graphicsData.title: The Beautiful Statue
graphicsData.description: To solve the crisis, Malli commissions a perfect, hollow statue of herself, which is placed in a grand hall for the kings to see.
graphicsData.imageAlt: Princess Malli standing beside a perfect, life-like statue of herself.

graphicsData.title: The Foul Truth
graphicsData.description: When Malli unseals the statue, a terrible smell from the rotten food inside fills the air, shocking the kings and teaching them about the body's true nature.
graphicsData.imageAlt: Six kings covering their noses in disgust as a foul smell emanates from the statue.

graphicsData.title: The Path to Liberation
graphicsData.description: Having learned their lesson and remembered their past lives, Malli and the six kings renounce the world to continue their spiritual journey.
graphicsData.imageAlt: Seven figures walking away from a palace towards a spiritual path.
